Article.Abstract: Here we describe the identification of a new CD8(+)-T-cell epitope, the GYAGTLQSL nonamer, shared by the TB10.3 and TB10.4 proteins of the Mycobacterium tuberculosis ESAT-6 family. Cytotoxic T cells from mycobacterium-infected mice efficiently recognized this epitope. GYAGTLQSL-specific T-cell hybridomas, which were able to recognize Mycobacterium bovis BCG-infected macrophages, were generated and now allow investigation of mycobacterial-antigen processing through the major histocompatibility complex class I pathway.
Article.ArticleTitle: CD8+-T-cell responses of Mycobacterium-infected mice to a newly identified major histocompatibility complex class I-restricted epitope shared by proteins of the ESAT-6 family.
Article.Affiliations: Unité de Biologie des Régulations Immunitaires, INSERM E352, Institut Pasteur, Paris, France. lmajless@pasteur.fr.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antigens, Bacterial;Bacterial Proteins;ESAT-6 protein, Mycobacterium tuberculosis;Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;Histocompatibility Antigens Class I
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Antigens, Bacterial(immunology); Bacterial Proteins; CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(chemistry; immunology); Histocompatibility Antigens Class I(metabolism); Hybridomas; Immunization; Macrophages(microbiology); Mice; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Molecular Sequence Data; Mycobacterium bovis(immunology); Mycobacterium tuberculosis(immunology); T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology); Tuberculosis, Pulmonary(immunology; microbiology)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Rv0288 and Rv3019c are low-molecular-weight proteinswith 84.4% sequence identity and constitute with Rv3017c a subfamily of the highly immunogenic ESAT-6 protein family.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Mice received two subcutaneous (s.c.) injectionsof 50 micrograms of individual peptides at a 2-week interval. Eight days following thelast injection, their lymph node cells were harvested.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Four CD8+ T-cell hybridomas specific for the epitope, namely, XH3, YB8, WC7, and KC6, produced IL-2 when stimulated with peptide in the presence of H-2d bone marrow-derived dendritic cells. The response was quantified in cpm.
This response was lost when mice were immunized with heat-killed BCG, and when effectors were depleted of CD8+, but not CD4+ T cells.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -Single MHC type present

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Three of four CD8+ T-cell hybridomas specific for the epitope produced IL-2 when stimulated with H-2d macrophages infected with BCG.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Rv0288 and Rv3019c are low-molecular-weight proteinswith 84.4% sequence identity and constitute with Rv3017c a subfamily of the highly immunogenic ESAT-6 protein family.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Four CD8+ T-cell hybridomas specific for the epitope, namely XH3, YB8, WC7, and KC6, produced IL-2 when stimulated with Raw 264.7 (H-2d) macrophages incubated with the epitope. The response was quantified in cpm.
